column2: # Create df with vocabulary size at 18 months
# curve_full %>% filter(age == 18.00) %>% # Use this line to use vocabulary size estimated by the logistic equation
midpoint_identification %>% filter(age >= 18 & age < 19) %>%  # Use this line to use actual vocabulary size (there might be babies with missing data)
summarise: now 8 rows and 3 columns, one group variable remaining (vocabulary_type_step1)
pivot_wider: reorganized (midp_identify, N) into (identified, not_identified) [was 8x3, now 4x3]
select(vocabulary_type_step1, Spurters.N,"18 Months.Spurters.M (SD)", "18 Months.Spurters.Range", Non_Spurters.N, "18 Months.Non-Spurters.M (SD)", "18 Months.Non-Spurters.Range") %>%
select: dropped 20 variables (n_months, age, starting_age, eng_completed, fr_completed, …)
pivot_wider: reorganized (vocabulary_score, midp_identify) into (identified, not_identified) [was 160x4, now 160x4]
summarise: now 4 rows and 9 columns, ungrouped
select: dropped 8 variables (Spurters.M, Spurters.SD, Spurters.Min, Spurters.Max, Non_Spurters.M, …)
title = c("Table 2", "Descriptive Statistics of Vocabulary Size at 18 Months"),
"Descriptive statistics of spurters and non-spurters in each vocabulary type."
